chain.description:
To assist with your text analysis tool, I will first find out which languages and categories of stopwords are available. This will allow us to see if the specific languages you need are supported.

Let's start by listing all available word categories.

chain.observation: {"error": "", "response": "[{'category_id': '1', 'category_name': 'Female Names', 'category_description': 'All approved female names', 'parent_category': '0', 'words': '20413'}, {'category_id': '2', 'category_name': 'Male Names', 'category_description': 'All approved male names', 'parent_category': '0', 'words': '16659'}, {'category_id': '3', 'category_name': 'General Aggressive', 'category_description': 'A large list of stop words. Will agressively remove common words in a country.', 'parent_category': '0', 'words': None}, {'category_id': '4', 'category_name': 'General Small', 'category_description': 'Small list of general stop words', 'parent_category': '0', 'words': '11850'}]"}

chain.description:
It appears that the service provides four categories of words: "Female Names," "Male Names," "General Aggressive," and "General Small." However, these categories are not specifically by language as you requested for stopwords. Unfortunately, the available categories may not align exactly with your need for language-specific stopwords.

Would you like to proceed with any of the available categories, or should I check if there's any other method to help you based on this tool?

{"return_type":"give_answer","final_answer":"Currently, the available categories of stopwords are 'Female Names', 'Male Names', 'General Aggressive', and 'General Small'. These categories are not language-specific. If you need stopwords from these categories, please let me know which ones specifically interest you. If you were looking for language-specific stopwords, this current tool may not meet your requirements. Please specify if there is any other way I can assist!"}

function.name: stopwords_for_free_stopwords

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

train_messages.content:
You are AutoGPT, you can use many tools(functions) to do the following task.
First I will give you the task description, and your task start.
At each step, you need to give your thought to analyze the status now and what to do next, with a function call to actually excute your step.
After the call, you will get the call result, and you are now in a new state.
Then you will analyze your status now, then decide what to do next...
After many (Thought-call) pairs, you finally perform the task, then you can give your finial answer.
Remember: 
1.the state change is irreversible, you can't go back to one of the former state, if you want to restart the task, say "I give up and restart".
2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.
Let's Begin!
Task description: You should use functions to help handle the real time user querys. Remember:
1.ALWAYS call "Finish" function at the end of the task. And the final answer should contain enough information to show to the user,If you can't handle the task, or you find that function calls always fail(the function is not valid now), use function Finish->give_up_and_restart.
2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.
You have access of the following tools:
1.free_stopwords: StopwordAPI.com offers an easy solution for you to retrive words that you want to remove from a string. This filtering process is common in NLP (Natural Language Processing) algoritms and whenever you want to remove words from user input in your software application. StopwordAPI.com has ordered the words into useful categories making it easy for you to only download the words you need - eventhough you do not know the language.

I am developing a text analysis tool and I need a list of stopwords for different languages. Can you provide me with stopwords for specific languages I want ? It would be helpful if you could also include details about each word.
